ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Re: eq at work
ygData.msgSnippet: I m currently trying to get my druid high enough to sow. Hopefully I ll have enough mana to sow once I get to that lvl. luv, -Su
ygData.messageBody:
I'm currently trying to get my druid high enough to sow. Hopefully I'll have
enough mana to sow once I get to that lvl.
luv,
-Su

> > ahh yes.. the ub3r d00ds of our great land.. such a
> > travesty.. :)
> >
> > i don't mind giving sows.. i often sit at home by
> > the PoD lift and buff.. but a "thank you, m'Lady" is
> > always welcome.. :)
>
> <nods> I try to do the same when I have a little
> downtime to kill. I often go to GFay to buy stacks of
> Spiderling Silks, usually park myself at newbie lift
> and give SoW's and whatnot. Same deal in EC tunnel.
> What's really starting to bug me is the number of
> Druids (and other classes for that matter) being
> downright stingy with things like SoW. I mean,
> nobody's obligated to give them out, but at least for
> me access to SoW was one of the primary reasons for
> playing a Druid, I don't mind sharing it cause I know
> how good it feels to be on the recieving end of one.
> (playing my rogue is maddening until some kind soul
> decides to SoW me, gods I need JBoots :) When
> something as simple as a laughably tiny amount of mana
> that will be recovered in two seconds of medding can
> enhance another person's gaming experience that much,
> I see it as a bargain. Plus, more often than not, for
> every ten or so SoW's I give out, I get a Clarity in
> exchange, or someone cuts me a deal on an item, or
> some other nicety. (had one guy give me a HQ Bear Pelt
> last night just because I SoWed him :) In a way I also
> view it as my contribution to the community as a
> whole. People have been very generous and helpful so
> far, it's the least I can do to give back a little. :)
>
